Publications

By Thomas Gumbricht Google scholar Researchgate Scopus Linkedin Orcid

Click on source icon to get online pdf versions (articles with no icon are not available online), or click the title to see abstract.

Journal articles

  • Gumbricht, T., Remote Sensing, 10(4), 611 2018. Detecting Trends in Wetland Extent from MODIS Derived Soil Moisture Estimates.
  • Gumbricht, T. et al., Global Change Biology, 23, 3581–3599 2017. An expert system model for mapping tropical wetlands and peatlands reveals South America as the largest contributor.
  • Vågen et al., Geoderma, 263, 216–225 2016. Mapping of soil properties and land degradation risk in Africa using MODIS reflectance.
  • Liebenow, D. et al., Ecological Economics, 82, 33–44 2012. Do ecosystem services influence household wealth in rural Mali?
  • Wolski, P. et al., Journal of Hydrology, 331(1–2), 58–72 2006. Modelling of the flooding in the Okavango Delta, Botswana, using a hybrid reservoir-GIS model.

  • Gumbricht, T. et al., J of Hydrology, 290(3–4), 178–191 2004. Forecasting the spatial extent of the annual flood in the Okavango delta, Botswana.
  • McCarthy, T. et al., Water SA, 30(1), 121–128 2004. Wastewater disposal at safari lodges in the Okavango Delta, Botswana.
  • Gumbricht, T., McCarthy, J., & McCarthy, T., Earth Surface Processes and Landforms, 29(1), 15–29 2004. Channels, wetlands and islands in the Okavango Delta, Botswana, and their relation to hydrological and sedimentological processes.
  • Andersson, L. et al., Physics and Chemistry of the Earth, Parts A/B/C, 28(20–27), 1165–1172 2003. Water flow dynamics in the Okavango River Basin and Delta – a prerequisite for the ecosystems of the Delta.
  • Gumbricht, T., & McCarthy, T., South African Geographical J, 85(2), 164–169 2003. Spatial patterns of islands and salt crusts in the Okavango Delta, Botswana.
  • McCarthy, J. et al., AMBIO: A Journal of the Human Environment, 32(7) 2003. Flooding Patterns of the Okavango Wetland in Botswana between 1972 and 2000.
  • Gumbricht, T. et al., South African J of Science, 98(7 & 8), 351–358 2002. Remote sensing to detect sub-surface peat fires and peat fire scars in the Okavango Delta, Botswana.
  • Gumbricht, T. et al., South African J of Geology, 104(3), 243–264 2001. The topography of the Okavango Delta, Botswana, and its tectonic and sedimentological implications.
  • Gumbricht, T. et al., Water Resources Development, 13(1), 67–78 1997. GIS Integrated Modelling of a Himalayan Landscape.
  • Gumbricht, T., & Thunvik, R., Nordic Hydrology (renamed: Hydrology Research), 28(4–5), 329–338 1997. 3D Hydrogeological Modelling with an Expert GIS Interface.
  • Gumbricht, T., McCarthy, J., & Mahlander, C., Ecological Engineering, 6(4), 273–279 1996. Digital interpretation and management of land cover — a case study of Cyprus.
  • Gumbricht, T, Journal of Environmental Management, 46(1), 17–30 1996. Application of GIS in Training for Environmental Management.
  • Gumbricht, T., Ecological Engineering, 2(1), 49–61 1993. Nutrient removal capacity in submersed macrophyte pond systems in a temperature climate.
  • Gumbricht, T, Ecological Engineering, 2(1), 1–30 1993. Nutrient removal processes in freshwater submersed macrophyte systems.
  • Gumbricht, T., Ecological Engineering, 1(3), 199–212 1992. Tertiary wastewater treatment using the root-zone method in temperate climates.
  • Gumbricht, T., Vatten, 47: 212-216 1991. Water resources management in Germany – with examples from Niedersachsen.
  • Gumbricht, T., Vatten, 47: 310-314 1991. Reduction of nutrients by water plants. Final report, the Snogeroed project
